DOC.brief_title: Dopamine Acute Decompensated Heart Failure II
DOC.detailed_description: The aim study compare effect : 1. high-dose furosemide ( HDF , 40 mg furosemide bolus IV , follow continuous IV infusion 20 mg/h total 8 hour ) , 2. low-dose furosemide ( LDF , 40 mg furosemide bolus IV , follow continuous IV infusion 5 mg/h furosemide total 8 hour ) , 3. low-dose furosemide combine low-dose dopamine ( LDFD , 40 mg furosemide bolus IV , follow continuous IV infusion 5 mg/h furosemide plus 5μg/kg/min dopamine total 8 hour ) diuresis , perceive dyspnea , renal function , electrolyte balance , total length stay , 60-day post-discharge outcome patient hospitalize ADHF .
DOC.criteria: patient New York Heart Association ( NYHA ) functional class IV heart failure accord American Heart Association ( AHA ) classification , namely dyspnea minimal exertion rest dyspnea , orthopnea , paroxysmal nocturnal dyspnea , sign congestion ( third heart sound pulmonary rale physical examination ) , pulmonary congestion chest xray , serum Btype natriuretic peptide level > 400 pg/ml NTproBNP > 1500 pg/ml , echocardiographic documentation systolic diastolic dysfunction , age > 18 year old , medical therapy ACEinhibitor and/or βblocker , experience acute decompensation know chronic HF , baseline oxygen saturation < 90 % admission arterial blood gas acute de novo HF ; severe renal failure ( serum creatinine > 200 μmol/L GFR < 30 ml/min/1.73m2 ) admission systolic blood pressure < 90 mm Hg ; severe valvular disease ; know adverse reaction furosemide dopamine ; HF secondary congenital heart disease ; schedule procedure need IV contrast dye ; schedule cardiac surgery within 6 month
